page.title: 16IMPACT OF OPENCAST MINING
page.content: KINNINMONTH FARMHOUSE WAS BUILT TEN YEARS AGO WHEN THE OLD FARMHOUSE WAS COVERED BY OVERBURDEN FROM THE WESTFIELD OPENCAST.THE OLD FARMHOUSE WAS FOUR OR FIVE TIMES BIGGER THAN THE NEW ONE WHICH IS WARMER AND MORE CONVENIENT TO MANAGE. ORIGINALLY THE FARM LOST ABOUT 108 ACRES BUT THE FARMER SAYS HE IS LOSING MORE LAND ALL THE TIME.AS YET HE HAS NOT RECEIVED ANY COMPENSATION.DURING OPERATIONS ABOUT 50m OF OVERBURDEN WAS REMOVED AND THE THICK COALSEAMS WERE WORKED IN THREE STAGES,HEADING NORTH UNTIL KINNINMONTH FARM WAS REACHED. MINING IN THE AREA ROUND HAS CEASED AND EVENTUALLY THE OPENCAST WILL BE PARTIALLY INFILLED WITH THE OVERBURDEN THE PROBLEM REMAINING FOR THE FARMER AT KINNINMONTH IS WHEN WILL HIS LAND BE REINSTATED?
